properties.name: activityEnterAnimation
properties.summary: Animation resource to run on the activity being opened.
properties.description: This value will be ignored if animated is set to false. See "Window Transitions in Android" in the main description of Titanium.UI.Window for more information.
properties.examples:
# Examples

# Sliding in a new Window
var win2 = Ti.UI.createWindow({fullscreen:false});
win2.open({
    activityEnterAnimation: Ti.Android.R.anim.slide_in_left,
    activityExitAnimation: Ti.Android.R.anim.slide_out_right
});

properties.name: activityExitAnimation
properties.summary: Animation resource to run on the activity that is being put in background as a window is being opened above it.
properties.description: This value will be ignored if animated is set to false. See "Window Transitions in Android" in the main description of Titanium.UI.Window for more information.

properties.name: animated
properties.summary: Determines whether to use an animated effect when the window is shown.
properties.description:
On Android, this property supports animated transitions on windows except for modal windows (modal:true). The transitions are on by default, but you can disable this behavior by setting this value to false.

On iOS, only use this property to disable animated transitions on modal windows. This property has unintended side effects on non-modal windows if it is defined.

properties.name: bottom
properties.description: On Android, this property has no effect.

properties.name: forceModal
properties.summary: Indicates whether the window enforces modal behaviour.
properties.description: Set to true to prevent interactive dismissal of window while it is onscreen.

properties.name: height
properties.description:
On Windows Phone and Windows 10 Mobile, this property does not take any effect. On Windows 10 Store App, resizing Window takes no effect in following cases according to Windows Runtime API document.

  • The requested size is larger than the available work area.
  • The requested size is less than the view's minimum size.
  • The smallest allowed minimum size is 192 x 48 effective pixels.
  • The largest allowed minimum size is 500 x 500 effective pixels.

properties.name: left
properties.description: On Android, this property has no effect.

properties.name: modal
properties.summary: Determines whether to open the window modal in front of other windows.

properties.name: navBarHidden
properties.summary: For modal windows, hides the nav bar (true) or shows the nav bar (false).
properties.description: On iOS, beginning with Release 3.1.3, this is no longer a valid parameter passed to the open method.

properties.name: right
properties.description: On Android, this property has no effect.

properties.name: top
properties.description: On Android, this property has no effect.

properties.name: width
properties.description:
On Windows Phone and Windows 10 Mobile, this property does not take any effect. On Windows 10 Store App, resizing Window takes no effect in following cases according to Windows Runtime API document.

  • The requested size is larger than the available work area.
  • The requested size is less than the view's minimum size.
  • The smallest allowed minimum size is 192 x 48 effective pixels.
  • The largest allowed minimum size is 500 x 500 effective pixels.
  • This method is called while in while the app is running in Tablet Mode.
